headline: Ford is entering a new EV era
summary: Ford (F) has unveiled its newest electric vehicle (EV) strategy: cheaper EVs instead of bigger EVs. Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton to explain exactly what investors need to know. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Ford’s Stock Won’t Stop Going Up
summary: A funny thing happened on the way to America’s EV disaster. Ford (NYSE: F), which took a $19.5 billion write-off for its EV mistakes, has a stock that will not stop rising. It is up 49% in the last year, and 7% so far in 2026. Ford has done investors a favor by getting all ... Ford’s Stock Won’t Stop Going Up

headline: Ford unveils new details on its cheaper EV platform. First up, a midsize pickup.
summary: Ford pivoted its EV plans, but it's not giving up. The company's focus — a brand-new universal electric vehicle (UEV) platform, built from the ground up with a "skunkworks" team in California, hived off from the rest of the automaker.

headline: Magna Stock Revs Nearly 20% In Massive Volume On Earnings; Gets Rating Upgrade
summary: In a breakout performance on Friday, auto systems and components maker Magna International shot up nearly 19% in 400% higher than average volume.  On Monday, Magna hit an important technical milestone, with its Relative Strength (RS) Rating moving into the 90-plus percentile with an improvement to 94, up from 88 the day before.  The upgraded 94 RS Rating shows that Detroit-based Magna is in the top 6% of all stocks for price performance over the past year.

The upgraded 94 RS Rating shows that Detroit-based Magna is in the top 6% of all stocks for price performance over the past year.

headline: Ford’s China And Geely Partnerships Put Global Costs And Valuation In Focus
summary: Ford Motor (NYSE:F) is pursuing deeper collaboration with Chinese automakers to set up joint ventures that would produce vehicles in the US with American firms retaining control. In Europe, Ford is in talks with Geely about using excess plant capacity and sharing technology, including autonomous driving systems. These partnership discussions are unfolding as Ford faces supply chain disruptions, unexpected tariff related expenses, and supplier fires that are affecting costs and...

headline: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From Ford’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Ford’s Q4 performance reflected a complex mix of cost headwinds, supply challenges, and evolving product demand. Management highlighted the impact of temporary aluminum supply disruptions, increased tariff expenses, and a deliberate shift in vehicle mix as primary drivers behind the quarter’s results. CEO Jim Farley described the company’s approach as “decisive,” noting progress in cost and quality improvements, the recall of older vehicles to address reliability, and rising U.S. market share. C
